title: Chapati
description: Ugandan chapati is a round-shaped flatbread -- a favorite served with many dishes.

ingredients.english: 1/4 cup ghee OR butter OR oil

directions.english: Combine the flour, salt, and 2 tablespoons of oil in a large bowl. Add sugar if you want to sweeten.
Add water slowly and mix until well combined. If too wet or dry, add more water or flour as needed.
Knead for 10 minutes until the dough does not stick to the bowl. Leave to rest for 1 hour covered with a damp cloth.
Preheat a large frying pan and brush the surface with 1 tablespoon of oil. Divide the dough into 10 equal balls.
Dust the work surface with flour and flatten the balls. Place one onto a floured board and roll to a flat, round, thin sheet.

Cook for about 30-60 seconds or until the surface is bubbling. Turn it over with tongs and cook the other side for 30 seconds or until brown spots appear. Repeat with the remaining balls flouring the board when necessary.
Stack the cooked chapatis on a warm plate and cover to keep them warm.
